articles.title: Kim Jong Il Visits Amur Region of Russian Federation
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Visits Amur Region of Russian Federation

					Pyongyang, August 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, visited Amur Region in the Far East Region of the Russian Federation on August 21.
					
					He arrived in Amur Region this morning.
					
					Flags of the two countries were seen fluttering at Bureya Railway Station and crowd was present there with pennants of the two countries in their hands.
					
					When the train pulled in the station, a military band played a welcome music and artistes of the Amur region folklore song and dance troupe danced to the tune of folk music. The crowd enthusiastically welcomed him, waving pennants of the two countries.
					
					He exchanged greetings with Oleg Kozhemyako, governor of Amur Region; Aleksandr Bashun, chairman of the Amur Region Legislative Assembly; Pavel Shtein, governor of the Bureya District Administration; and other leading officials of the region, city and district who came to greet him and Viktor Ishayev, presidential envoy to the Far East Region of the Russian Federation; and Valery E. Sukhinin, Russian ambassador to the DPRK; who were conducting him on a visit to the Far East Region.
					
					He was offered bread and salt by Russian women in graceful national costumes according to their customs.
					
					He was accompanied by Kim Yong Chun, member of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee and minister of the People's Armed Forces, Kang Sok Ju, member of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee and vice-premier of the Cabinet, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee and vice-chairman of the NDC, Kim Yang Gon, Pak To Chun and Thae Jong Su, alternate members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the WPK Central Committee, Ju Kyu Chang, alternate member of the Political Bureau and department director of the WPK Central Committee, Pak Pong Ju, first vice department director of the WPK Central Committee, O Su Yong, chief secretary of the North Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the WPK, Kim Kye Gwan, first vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Kim Yong Jae, DPRK ambassador to Russia, and Sim Kuk Ryong, consul general of the DPRK Consulate General in Nakhodka of Russia.
					
					He visited the Bureya Hydro-electric Plant, a large power base in the Far East Region of Russia.
					
					He was greeted on the spot by Igori Goluptsov, director of the plant, and its senior officials.
					
					After being briefed on the history of the plant, he acquainted himself in detail with the construction and electricity production, going round the generating room and other places.
					
					Commanding a bird's-eye view of the giant plant from the observation deck, he said it is a great structure to go down in the history of Russia.
					
					Highly praising the brave and talented Russian people for having built the modern large-scale hydro-electric plant by harnessing nature for dozens of years, he expressed expectation that the workers of the plant would keep the electricity production going at a high rate and contribute to the economic development in the Far East Region and its people's wellbeing.
					
					He wrote in the visitor's book: "Inexhaustible is the strength of the Russian people who occupied Bureya nature. Kim Jong Il. August 21, 2011."
					
					The director of the plant presented him with a gift which was prepared with sincerity carrying boundless respect and reverence of all its employees for him.
					
					The governor of the region gave a luncheon in honor of Kim Jong Il on a visit to the region.
					
					Warmly welcoming Kim Jong Il visiting the Far East Region for the strengthening and development of the Russia-DPRK friendship on behalf of the Regional Government and people, the governor expressed the pleasure to receive in their region the leader in good health and full of energy.
					
					The luncheon proceeded in an amicable atmosphere overflowing with friendship.
					
					An art performance prepared by the artistes of the region was given in welcome of him.
					
					He was presented with a gift by the governor on behalf of the officials and people of the region in token of his historic visit to the region.
					
					He left for his next destination amid the warm send-off by senior officials of the region.

articles.title: Chinese Cargo Vessel Rescues DPRK Citizens
articles.content:
Chinese Cargo Vessel Rescues DPRK Citizens

					Pyongyang, August 21 (KCNA) -- The sailors of a Chinese cargo vessel rescued ten DPRK citizens adrift on the lower River Amnok on Aug. 2.
					
					The drifters, farmers of the Songso Co-op Farm in Sinuiju City, North Phyongan Province, were cutting grass at ebb tide on the bank of the river that day but with the tide at its flow they began to go adrift.
					
					Chinese officials who were doing work for the construction of the DPRK-China River Amnok Bridge sent transport ship Liaodongyun 127 to conduct emergency rescue operation.
					
					The rescued farmers and officials expressed thanks to the Chinese side. The Chinese side said that it was their obligation before the Korean people to move the Koreans more deeply.
					
					The laudable deed of Chinese will always go down in the history of the DPRK-China friendship.

articles.title: DPRK Female Marathoner Wins Gold Medal
articles.content:
DPRK Female Marathoner Wins Gold Medal

					Pyongyang, August 21 (KCNA) -- DPRK players have gained successes at the 26th Summer Universiade in Shenzhen, China.
					
					Ro Un Ok won a gold medal in the women's half marathon on August 21.

articles.title: Foreigners Arrive to Participate in Rason International Trade Fair
articles.content:
Foreigners Arrive to Participate in Rason International Trade Fair

					Pyongyang, August 21 (KCNA) -- Delegates and exhibitors of China, Russia, Australia, Italy, the U.S. and Taiwan of China arrived in Rason City Saturday to participate in the First International Trade Fair.

articles.title: Japan Hit for Avoiding Liquidation of Past
articles.content:
Japan Hit for Avoiding Liquidation of Past

					Pyongyang, August 21 (KCNA) -- The International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions on August 17 posted on its Internet homepage an article titled "Japan avoids liquidation of its disgraceful and dirty past".
					
					The article said:
					
					Inglorious past is being redressed and issues that were left outstanding after the war are being coordinated among countries in the direction of making progress and establishing new relations based on reconciliation and cooperation. This has become the trend of the times.
					
					Japan, however, is going against this international trend.
					
					Abnormal relations still exist between the DPRK and Japan.
					
					Japan is totally to blame for this as it has persistently avoided the liquidation of its past, far from admitting them.
					
					The Japanese imperialists forcibly walked away and kidnapped many Koreans and forced them to do slavery labor and fight wars, ruthlessly killing them in the end. These were the biggest crimes they committed against the Koreans.
					
					From the first days of their occupation of Korea they maltreated and exploited the Korean people like animals.
					
					They forced Korean women ranging from girls in teens to married women into sexual slavery and tried to obliterate the national identity and culture of the Korean people.
					
					66 years have passed since its defeat but Japan is making desperate efforts to shirk the responsibility for the past crimes, neither admitting nor making apology and reparation. This reveals its impudence and moral vulgarity.
					
					Japan should not fan up the fever for reinvasion of Korea but make honest admission, apology and thoroughgoing reparation for its past crimes.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Decries UFG Military Exercises
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Decries UFG Military Exercises

					Pyongyang, August 21 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Internet paper Jaju Minbo in a commentary on August 16 condemned the U.S. and the south Korean authorities for their dangerous joint military exercises for a war against the north.
					
					They started the provocative Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises on August 16, the commentary said, noting that the saber-rattling which will last till August 26 is a dangerous play with fire which may possibly lead to the second Korean war in view of the huge armed forces involved.
					
					This time the authorities let civilians on five islands in the West Sea of Korea and other places stage Ulji training, an independent drill to cope with an actual war, it said. This fully reveals the nature of aggression of the on-going military exercises.
					
					The commentary urged the warmongers to immediately stop the large-scale war maneuvers for a war against the north.

articles.title: Broad Investigation into U.S. Forces' Environmental Pollution Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Broad Investigation into U.S. Forces' Environmental Pollution Called for in S. Korea

					Pyongyang, August 21 (KCNA) -- The south Korean People's Defoliant Measure Council held a press conference in Seoul on August 17 and announced the results of its investigation into the U.S. forces' environmental degradation in Waegwan, Chilgok County, North Kyongsang Province.
					
					Speakers said the results of their investigation into the surroundings of the U.S. military base in Waegwan from July 13 to 15 proved that many inhabitants died of leukemia, anemia, various cancers, skin disease, nerve disturbance and other diseases. There are lots of people still suffering, they added.
					
					The authorities, too, made a joint investigation with the U.S. forces side but, announcing its results, they said the cause for the detection of various toxic materials in the underground water within the base compound has not been confirmed, the speakers charged.
					
					The authorities have not yet kept their promise to start the medical check-up of the inhabitants in the afflicted area, they said.
					
					A systematic and broad investigation into the pollution of the U.S. military base in Waegwan should be made on the basis of the results of the recent investigation conducted by civic and public organizations, representatives and experts recommended by the inhabitants, they stressed.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Sidestepping Registration Fee Issue
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Sidestepping Registration Fee Issue

					Pyongyang, August 21 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Consultative Meeting for Getting Registration Fee Halved grouping opposition parties, people of civic and public circles, university students and their parents held a meeting at the "National Assembly" building on August 16. It accused the puppet conservative authorities of sidestepping the registration fee issue.
					
					Speakers said the registration fee issue has not progressed for which the "Grand National Party" is to blame.
					
					Students are subject to harsh labor, unable to study even during vacation, in order to get money to pay for the registration fee, they deplored. The authorities, however, have not done anything yet, they charged.
					
					The "government" and the GNP should come out with sincere attitude to get the registration fee halved though belatedly, they urged, underlining the need to expand demonstrations and meetings.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Stirring up Japan's Ambition for Reinvasion of Korea
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Stirring up Japan's Ambition for Reinvasion of Korea

					Pyongyang, August 21 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities are actively backing the Japanese reactionaries in their moves to grab Tok Islets and mark the East Sea of Korea as "Japan Sea".
					
					Minju Joson Sunday says this in a byline commentary.
					
					The Japanese reactionaries are working hard to stage a comeback to Korea, far from redeeming their hideous crime-woven past. They are defying the universally recognized demand from a legal viewpoint for an assailant to make apology and reparation to a victim, a news analyst of the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					What merits serious attention is the south Korean conservative authorities' pro-Japanese act of treachery of instigating the Japanese reactionaries to reinvade Korea.
					
					As already known, when instructing the south Korean ambassador to Japan as regards the Tok Islets issue after taking office, the conservative group said "Stay calm even though the Japanese side provokes first". The Japanese reactionaries have further accelerated the moves to grab Tok Islets, taking advantage of the pro-Japanese acts of treachery on the part of the conservative group that would put even the five traitors of 1905 into the shade. It is clearly evidenced by the recent one-month row kicked up by the Japanese reactionaries over the test flight by a south Korean airliner in the sky above Tok Islets. The Japanese issued a travel ban on south Korean airliners and pushed forward the LDP lawmakers' plan to visit Ullung Island.
					
					The south Korean chief executive in his address to mark "August 15" did not mention the Japanese reactionaries' attempt to grab the islets at all. This was unpardonable treachery little short of egging the Japanese reactionaries on to realize their ambition to stage a comeback to Korea.
					
					Clear is the aim sought by the conservative authorities by fanning up the Japanese reactionaries' moves to reinvade Korea. That is to do harm to fellow countrymen in collusion with the Japanese reactionaries. The conservative group only seeks to hurt compatriots even by relying on outside forces.
					
					The Japanese reactionaries, well aware of this, are making desperate efforts to seize Tok Islets during the tenure of the present conservative group in south Korea.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Army in Afghanistan Attacked by Rockets
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Army in Afghanistan Attacked by Rockets

					Pyongyang, August 21 (KCNA) -- A unit of the south Korean puppet army dispatched to Afghanistan to join the U.S. imperialists in their  war of aggression was attacked again by rockets on August 14, according to south Korean MBC. 
					
					Four rockets out of six fired by the Afghan armed forces suddenly slammed into the base of the south Korean army that evening.
					
					This was the 13th attack on the puppet army in Afghanistan this year.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Songun Policy Lauded
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Songun Policy Lauded

					Pyongyang, August 21 (KCNA) -- Lectures were given in Sweden, Iran and Democratic Congo between Aug. 12 and 16 on the occasion of the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of Songun revolutionary leadership and the 66th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					The chief of the Swedish Group for the Study of the Juche Idea said that Aug. 15 marked the start of the new history of the Korean nation and socialist Korea, highly praising the feats of President Kim Il Sung in liberating Korea,  adding:
					
					On Aug. 25 1960 leader Kim Jong Il gave on-the-spot guidance to Seoul Ryu Kyong Su 105 Guards Tank Division of the Korean People's Army, starting his Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					He has since wisely led the work to bolster the national power with priority given to it.
					
					Now the U.S. and the south Korean authorities are getting ever more undisguised in the move to provoke a war against the DPRK.
					
					But the DPRK remains unfazed as the political and military might has grown stronger in every way thanks to the Songun policy of  Kim Jong Il.
					
					The general director of the International Relations of Iranian Workers' House noted that Kim Jong Il developed in depth the Songun idea fathered by the President to meet the requirements of the prevailing situation and the developing revolution and enforced the Songun policy.
					
					He said that it is thanks to the wise and experienced Songun policy of Kim Jong Il that the DPRK have achieved great successes in economic and military construction despite the persistent sanctions and pressure of the U.S. and its followers.
					
					The vice-chairman of the Youth Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Democratic Congo said that thanks to the Songun policy of Kim Jong Il the single-minded unity of the DPRK society has reached the highest level and world-startling changes have taken place in all fields.

articles.title: Joint Seminar in Russia Calls for Learning from Songun Politics
articles.content:
Joint Seminar in Russia Calls for Learning from Songun Politics

					Pyongyang, August 21 (KCNA) -- A joint seminar was held in Russia on August 14 on the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership and the 66th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					Present there were officials and members of the International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions, the All-Russian Society for the Study and Dissemination of Kimilsungism, the Russian Society for Promoting the Study and Dissemination of Comrade Kim Jong Il's Works, the Kim Jong Suk Women's Union of Russia and the Russian Youth Association for the Study of the Songun Policy.
					
					Mikhail Panchenko, general secretary of the International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions, made a report at the seminar.
					
					President Kim Il Sung organized and waged the anti-Japanese armed struggle for a long period to take back the country usurped by the Japanese imperialists, he said. The liberation of Korea instilled great inspiration and conviction into the world oppressed people, he added.
					
					Kim Jong Il formulated the Songun politics as the basic political mode under socialism and has led the socialist cause to victory by relying on the People's Army in order to defend the sovereignty of the popular masses won at the cost of blood, he stressed.
					
					Dmitryev Andrei, chairman of the All-Russian Society for the Study and Dissemination of Kimilsungism, in his speech noted that the future of the single-minded unity of the society of the DPRK rallied close around Kim Jong Il is firmly guaranteed by the Songun politics.
					
					Yevgeni Pablenko, vice-chairman of the Russian Youth Association for the Study of the Songun Policy, stressed that only when one learns from the Songun politics of the DPRK, one can defend the sovereignty, dignity, peace and stability of the country.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats Praised by Foreign Papers
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats Praised by Foreign Papers

					Pyongyang, August 21 (KCNA) -- Foreign papers carried special write-ups with photos of leader Kim Jong Il on the 51st anniversary of his start of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					The Indian paper Science Technology and Education News on August 16 carried an article titled "Songun and Kim Jong Il". It said Kim Jong Il has developed in depth the Songun idea founded by President Kim Il Sung, father of socialist Korea, and comprehensively applied the Songun politics.
					
					Another Indian paper Public News introduced in detail Kim Jong Il's historic leadership over Seoul Ryu Kyong Su 105 Guards Tank Division of the Korean People's Army. The unit has grown to be formidable ranks capable of beating back any strong enemy under the care of the brilliant commander, it added.
					
					The Nepali paper Jana Sata on August 13 in an article said the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il has remarkably strengthened the single-minded unity of the society of the DPRK.
					
					The Bangladeshi paper Natun Bangla on August 15 devoted one whole page to special write-ups under the headline "On 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of Songun revolutionary leadership".
					
					The paper praised his Songun politics with which he firmly defended peace and security in the Korean Peninsula and the region while shattering the U.S. imperialists and their followers' moves to ignite a new war.
					
					The August 15th issue of another Bangladeshi paper Natun Katha and the August 14th issue of Pakistani paper Baluchistan Times carried articles which said that the Songun politics is, indeed, the most effective political mode that provides a firm guarantee for the victorious advance of socialism and the cause of independence.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of Songun Leadership Marked in Bangladesh
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of Songun Leadership Marked in Bangladesh

					Pyongyang, August 21 (KCNA) -- The Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea on August 16 issued bulletin titled "Songun and Juche cause" on the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					The bulletin said in an article:
					
					Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership 51 years ago was a historic event which declared that the DPRK entered a new era in which it would advance along the path of Songun to successfully accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					He has strengthened the People's Army into the pillar and the main force of the revolution and firmly defended the destiny and sovereignty of the country and the nation by relying on the powerful military capacity.
					
					Taking place in succession in the DPRK are such big events and changes as the successful launch of satellite Kwangmyongsong-2, production of Juche iron, Juche vinalon and Juche fertilizer, frontiers of the latest science and technology being pushed back by CNC technology and completion of the construction of the Taegyedo Reclaimed Tideland.
					
					Victory and glory will always be in store for the DPRK thanks to his Songun revolutionary leadership, the single-minded unity of all servicepersons and people rallied close around the headquarters of the revolution and strong military capacity.

articles.title: Korean Book, Photo and Handiwork Exhibition Mark Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Visit to Russia
articles.content:
Korean Book, Photo and Handiwork Exhibition Marks Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Visit to Russia

					Pyongyang, August 21 -- An exhibition of Korean books, photos and handiwork opened in Sankt-Petersburg City, Russia Monday on the 10th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's historic visit to Russia and the adoption of the Korea-Russia Moscow Declaration.
					
					Displayed in the exhibition hall were works of the peerless great men, photos on Kim Jong Il's visit to Russia and his Songun revolutionary leadership feats and handiwork associated with the creative talents of the Korean people
					
					The Russians of different circles and citizens of Sankt－Petersburg City attended its opening ceremony.
					
					The participants presented floral baskets before the portraits of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					This was followed by speeches.
					
					The citizens still remember the days when Kim Jong Il was visiting Russia, said Bavichi, vice-chairman of the Legislation Committee of the Sankt－Petersburg City Assembly. He wished the Korean people bigger successes in the economic construction and in the drive for improving the standard of people's living under Kim Jong Il's leadership. 
					
					Gavidov, top deputy governor of Novgorod Region, said that the exhibition would help the Russian people know better about the Korean people who are performing miracles and innovations in all fields including politics, economy and culture under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: 10th Asian Meeting to Settle Comfort Woman Issue Held
articles.content:
10th Asian Meeting to Settle Comfort Woman Issue Held

					Pyongyang, August 21 (KCNA) -- 10th Asian solidarity meeting for settling the issue of comfort women for the Imperial Japanese Army was held in Seoul from August 12 to 14.
					
					Report and speeches were made at the meeting.
					
					A resolution adopted there said the Japanese government should formally admit and apologize for the criminal fact that the Imperial Japanese Army had took away women from Asian-Pacific region and forced them into the sexual slavery from the 1930s till its defeat.
					
					To this end, the Japanese government should open all documents related to the issue of comfort women to the public and probe the truth. The Japanese Diet should institute a special law on Japan's apology and reparation at an early date, it urged.
					
					Whatever violent words and acts on the part of Japan to deny the comfort women issue should not be tolerated, it noted.
					
					The participants announced their action plan.
					
					It said they would wage resolute struggle against the Japanese government and Diet to make them institute a law on Japan's earlier formal apology and reparation.
					
					They would wage strong solidarity actions with the world civic organizations as an immediate step with the 1000th Wednesday rally for the solution of the comfort women issue due on December 14 this year as an occasion, it noted.
					
					It urged the need to build the international opinion critical of the Japanese government. It also called on all the Asian countries to continue support for the victims.
					
					They would teach right history to the upcoming generations in the future, it stressed.

articles.title: UFG Censured by German Organization
articles.content:
UFG Censured by German Organization

					Pyongyang, August 21 (KCNA) -- The German Branch of the Korean Friendship Association issued a statement on August 17 denouncing the U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises.
					
					The statement said:
					
					The United States and the south Korean authorities started the Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises despite the repeated warnings of the DPRK.
					
					Such provocation will vitiate the atmosphere of dialogue and drive the situation on the Korean Peninsula to an extreme phase as it is a dangerous saber-rattling simulating the aggression of the north.
					
					We bitterly condemn the south Korean puppet clique for its reckless war moves in collusion with the U.S imperialists.
					
					The statement urged the U.S. and the south Korean authorities to stop at once the joint military exercises to show that they are sincere in their attitude toward dialogue and peace.

articles.title: SADC Summit Held
articles.content:
SADC Summit Held

					Pyongyang, August 21 (KCNA) -- A summit of the Southern African Development Community (SADC) was held in Angola from August 17 to 18.
					
					Attending there were heads of state and government from the SADC member nations.
					
					Discussed at the summit were the issues to push forward the infrastructure construction for expanding economic relations among member nations to lay the foundation for regional integration, peacefully settle disputes and ensure regional stability.
					
					Prior to it, a meeting of the Ministerial Council of the SADC was held on August 16.

articles.title: Iran Plans to Develop Military Technique
articles.content:
Iran Plans to Develop Military Technique

					Tehran, August 20 (KCNA) -- Iranian Defense Minister in an interview with a news agency on August 16 clarified the stand of his country to positively develop the military technique.
					
					Iran has made great progress in the area of defense over the past few years, he said. "Today, participating in promoting the defensive capability to counter threats and dispel dangers is a national and religious duty," he was quoted as saying.
					
					Iran will in the future, too, pay big efforts to developing military technique to be among the advanced states in this field, he declared.

articles.title: Iran, Venezuela Call for Joint Struggle against Imperialism
articles.content:
Iran, Venezuela Call for Joint Struggle against Imperialism

					Pyongyang, August 21 (KCNA) -- Iran's President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad and his Venezuelan counterpart Hugo Chavez, during a telephone conversation, called for further expansion of bilateral cooperation in line with joint struggle against imperialism and bullying powers.
					
					They reiterated that Iran and Venezuela will always be together in fight against imperialism and bullying powers and also in administration of justice.
					
					They said the two countries, through joint cooperation and coordination with all world freedom lovers, can neutralize conspiracies of imperialism against independent and free nations across the globe.

articles.title: Nigeria Launches Satellite in Russia
articles.content:
Nigeria Launches Satellite in Russia

					Pyongyang, August 21 (KCNA) -- Nigeria launched earth observation satellites on August 17 as part of its efforts to develop the space.
					
					NigeriaSat2 and NigeriaSat-X, new earth observation satellites, were successfully launched into orbit in Russia. They would greatly contribute to the economic development of Nigeria, said the spokesperson for the National Space Research Development.

articles.title: Cholera Kills Nearly 500 in Cameroon
articles.content:
Cholera Kills Nearly 500 in Cameroon

					Pyongyang, August 21 (KCNA) -- Nearly 500 people have died of cholera in Cameroon this month, said public health officials on August 15. 
					
					13 000 cases have been reported in the country this year.
					
					The government is taking steps to control cholera from spreading.

articles.title: Different Countries Cooperate
articles.content:
Different Countries Cooperate

					Pyongyang, August 21 (KCNA) -- Vietnam, Laos and Thailand on August 17 agreed to boost mutual cooperation in combating drug trafficking.
					
					On August 16 Chile and Colombia signed agreements to have positive dialogue in the political, economic, cultural and other fields.

articles.title: Natural Disasters Claim Lives in Japan, Philippines
articles.content:
Natural Disasters Claim Lives in Japan, Philippines

					Pyongyang, August 21 (KCNA) -- As many as 7 071 people were taken to hospital due to heatstroke across Japan in one week through August 14. Of the 7 071, 15 people died. This is attributable to extreme heat of 35 C or higher gripping many parts of the country. 
					
					Three people have been killed and several others reported missing on August 16 when a landslide caused by heavy rains hit a mining village in southern Philippines.

articles.title: Prices Rise in U.S.
articles.content:
Prices Rise in U.S.

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- Over the past 12 months ending June, wholesale prices were up 7.2 percent in the U.S., reported the Labor Department on Wednesday.
					
					Foodstuff and energy prices, in particular, were up among others.

articles.title: Eurozone Trade Deficit Increases
articles.content:
Eurozone Trade Deficit Increases

					Pyongyang, August 21 (KCNA) -- For the 27-nation EU, trade balance for June recorded a deficit of 12.2 billion euros, about 1.1 billion higher than a year ago, the European Union (EU)'s statistics bureau Eurostat said on Tuesday.

articles.title: Volcano Erupts in Indonesia
articles.content:
Volcano Erupts in Indonesia

					Pyongyang, August 21 (KCNA) -- Mount Lokon, an active volcano located in Indonesia's North Sulawesi province, erupted on Wednesday afternoon, forcing people living around the volcano to seek refuge.
					
					Rain of volcanic ashes was reported up to 3 kilometers away from Tompaluan crater, the center of the eruption.

articles.title: Indian President Emphasizes on Elimination of Corruption
articles.content:
Indian President Emphasizes on Elimination of Corruption

					New Delhi, August 20 (KCNA) -- Addressing the Indian nation on the eve of the 65th Independence Day, India's President Mrs. Pratibha Devisingh Patil on Sunday evening emphasized on elimination of corruption.
					
					"Corruption is a cancer affecting our nation's political, economic, cultural and social life. It is necessary to eliminate it," said Patil in a televised address.
					
					"We need strong institutions and we need good governance in the country. Our institutions need to be fortified and our governance constantly improved," she added.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il visita la region de Amur de Rusia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il visita la region de Amur de Rusia

					Pyongyang, 21 de agosto (ACNC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, visito el dia 21 la region de Amur en el Lejano Oriente de la Federacion Rusa.
					
					El llego a esa region este dia por la manana.
					
					En la estacion ferroviaria de Bureya, flameaban a todo viento las banderas de Corea y Rusia y se veia una multitud con los banderines de ambos paises en sus manos.
					
					A la llegada del Dirigente, una banda militar comenzo a interpretar la musica de bienvenida y los artistas del Conjunto de Canciones y Danzas Folcloricas de la region de Amur le recibieron hospitalariamente bailando al son de cantos populares divertidos y agitando los banderines de ambos paises.
					
					El intercambio saludos con los cuadros de la region, ciudad y municipio, tales como el gobernador de la region de Amur, Oleg Nikolayevich Kozhemyako, el presidente del consejo legislativo de la region de Amur, Aleksandr Bashun, el gobernador del municipio de Bureya, Pavel Shtein, y con el delegado plenipotenciario del presidente en la Zona Federal del Lejano Oriente, Viktor Ishayev, quien acompana al Dirigente para guiar su visita al Lejano Oriente, y el embajador ruso en Corea, Valery E. Sukhinin.
					
					Mujeres rusas en elegantes vestimentas nacionales le invitaron a probar el pan y sal segun la costumbre nacional de Rusia.
					
					Le acompanan en la ocasion Kim Yong Chun, miembro del Buro Politico del Comite Central del PTC y ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, Kang Sok Ju, miembro del BP del CC del PTC y viceprimer ministro del Consejo de Ministros, Jang Song Thaek, miembro suplente del BP del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional, Kim Yang Gon, Pak To Chun y Thae Jong Su, miembros suplentes del BP y secretarios del CC del PTC, Ju Kyu Chang, miembro suplente del BP y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Pak Pong Ju, primer subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC, O Su Yong, secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Provincia de Hamgyong del Norte, Kim Kye Gwan, primer viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores, Kim Yong Jae, embajador coreano en Rusia, y Sim Kuk Ryong, consul general coreano acreditado en Najodka.
					
					Kim Jong Il visito la Central Hidroelectrica de Bureya, gran base de produccion energetica del Lejano Oriente.
					
					Le acogieron en ese lugar el gerente Igori Koluptsov y otros funcionarios directivos de la central.
					
					Tras escuchar el historial de la central, se informo en detalles del estado de construccion y generacion electrica recorriendo varios puntos como la cabina de generadores.
					
					Al disfrutar el majestuoso perfil de la central desde el observatorio, destaco que ella es una de las grandes creaciones a ser registradas en la historia de Rusia.
					
					Evaluando altamente el hecho de que el valiente y talentoso pueblo ruso construyo esa moderna planta hidroelectrica de gran dimension luchando por decadas contra los fenomenos naturales desfavorables, expreso la esperanza de que los obreros de ella contribuyan al desarrollo economico del Lejano Oriente y al fomento del bienestar del pueblo mediante la normalizacion de produccion electrica.
					
					Luego, escribio en el libro de visitas: "Son inagotables las fuerzas del pueblo ruso que conquisto la naturaleza de Bureya. El 21 de agosto de 2011, Kim Jong Il".
					
					El gerente le obsequio regalo preparado traduciendo el gran respeto y veneracion de todos los empleados de la central.
					
					Oleg Kozhemyako ofrecio un almuerzo en honor del Dirigente.
					
					En nombre del gobierno y habitantes de la region, Kozhemyako dio calida bienvenida al Dirigente, quien visito el Lejano Oriente para el fortalecimiento y desarrollo de la amistad Rusia-Corea. Y se mostro complacido por tener en su region al Dirigente saludable y vigoroso.
					
					La recepcion transcurrio en una atmosfera amistosa y amena.
					
					Los artistas de la region ofrecieron una funcion para saludar al Dirigente.
					
					En representacion de la devocion de funcionarios y habitantes de Amur, Kozhemyako dirigio un presente al Dirigente como recuerdo de su historica visita.
					
					Kim Jong Il partio hacia su proximo destino recibiendo el hospitalario saludo de despedida de los cuadros de la region.
